Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"depositAssets(address[],uint256[],uint256,address)":{"details":"Deposit final assets (pool assets) to the strategy and minting of vault shares. Can be strategy assets, underlying asset or specific set of assets depending on strategy logic.","minSharesOut":"Slippage tolerance. Minimal shares amount which must be received by user.","receiver":"Receiver of deposit. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas."},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"tokenId()":{"details":"VaultManager token ID. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `value`."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `value`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `value`."},"tvl()":{"details":"USD price of assets managed by strategy with 18 decimals      ONLY FOR OFF-CHAIN USE. bSDSQX7"]},"src/interfaces/IAprOracle.sol":{"keccak256":"0x72e3be2a0ce1e19aecaf82ea7e16ee08d7dbe9ec6e5b4a109b9b2573f7be248d","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://e18b0261db153e856d5b92aa1d788a4fa3dd8ce779be947402222ad2b475deb0","dweb:/ipfs/QmT9HZoU14LNGhjQLWyiG1JajtJ5wa3MgG4SK2jtsq1pBo"]},"src/interfaces/IControllable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8a521d5aeeaf4b657c31afc9fca59a28fc24e74aed9e04506d6153d2fb77ec27","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://5c17e029ba26643ac60e8cb66bfa79d7b76862bd620378b2e67b39ce14ad615b","dweb:/ipfs/QmWinXjYXuSiYhzPTJhm7PXqQtaKBjpT2X5BG2TaqUzaMc"]},"src/interfaces/IFactory.sol":{"keccak256":"0xefaaf137be5e5b0f85229ddaed95b7381a851933e9aa6c9c9b13b0e4faa53a69","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://943c32a25e3daaa2f6b0e5f38e3e5a4f7850c7063d72eae3f3c2b3906161e5e5","dweb:/ipfs/QmVHJcJ5YwYPAmDM67UPbburgVD48tXfYqEnhLVqyGdqgp"]},"src/interfaces/IPlatform.sol":{"keccak256":"0xe9a96c5f3212bff7fe4d1d759512172308fe5175040c49de1eebf1c247d951a2","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://ff7b8aab911cfd7e67d32c73a9ea1410dfc76e9046edc5ecc872d64cb0fcef78","dweb:/ipfs/QmbM3MvrarNRiuJKEpkYgWJjypa31HEVATHfcefPuagqp1"]},"src/interfaces/IPriceReader.sol":{"keccak256":"0xd434c78564a01de6c5409b494428eeaae1d7350928819abf39b18832236e40b9","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://b1051323b2b3dccccb71b2fe71371c5a6e10d2448d0a6d2a34410b8cc315878b","dweb:/ipfs/QmSXD4x586v1aLMdRjmh6FEr8XCmN5aZfaQXXBdcgW5Q1H"]},"src/interfaces/IStrategy.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf57019df4bed4a5dc8f2afa601a700139faa0d76d7120b5b39596d0d0fc0138b","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://3f4d7de3f8b5479a64f6f625fcaa1c09d58a5823b2e7a6f9ec33c1625442ea42","dweb:/ipfs/QmUg7a5hJdyR28kA5gu3qqJmcTj1ayHY3xXEn8rvnA6yBx"]},"src/interfaces/IVault.sol":{"keccak256":"0xb480f805dc7f0c0351fc5a897186b52b61accfde6f3658a94548ab88d9fb2a3a","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://db5692fbee9e6f76766a27ac9730c1c358594031a87bfa759de57250ebc1b6c5","dweb:/ipfs/QmNsVR8AkDG1unAVgX7MwDLer9YVgdeh3Jyyzzv5doYJke"]}},"version":1}

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

depositAssets(address[],uint256[],uint25.details: Deposit final assets (pool assets) to the strategy and minting of vault shares.      If the strategy interacts with a pool or farms through an underlying token, then it will be minted.      Emits a {DepositAssets} event with consumed amounts.

params.amountsMax: Available amounts of assets_ that user wants to invest in vault
params.assets_: Assets suitable for the strategy. Can be strategy assets, underlying asset or specific set of assets depending on strategy logic.
params.minSharesOut: Slippage tolerance. Minimal shares amount which must be received by user.
params.receiver: Receiver of deposit. If receiver is zero address, receiver is msg.sender.

doHardWork().details: Calling the strategy HardWork by operator with optional compensation for spent gas from the vault balance

doHardWorkOnDeposit().details: Trigger doHardwork on invest action. Enabled by default.

returns._0: Vault type color, background color and other extra data

returns.strategyApr: Strategy investmnt APR declared on last HardWork.
returns.totalApr: Total APR of investing money to vault. 18 decimals: 1e18 - +100% per year.

initialize((address,address,string,strin.details: This function is usually called by the Factory during the creation of a new vault.

params.vaultInitializationData: Data structure containing parameters for vault initialization.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

previewDepositAssets(address[],uint256[].details: Calculation of consumed amounts, shares amount and liquidity/underlying value for provided available amounts of strategy assets

params.amountsMax: Available amounts of assets_ that user wants to invest in vault
params.assets_: Assets suitable for vault strategy. Can be strategy assets, underlying asset or specific set of assets depending on strategy logic.

returns.amountsConsumed: Amounts of strategy assets that can be deposited by providing amountsMax
returns.sharesOut: Amount of vault shares that will be minted
returns.valueOut: Liquidity value or underlying token amount that will be received by the strategy

price().details: USD price of share with 18 decimals.      ONLY FOR OFF-CHAIN USE.      Not trusted vault share price can be manipulated.

returns.price_: Price of 1e18 shares with 18 decimals precision
returns.trusted_: True means oracle price, false means AMM spot price

setDoHardWorkOnDeposit(bool).details: If activated will call doHardWork on strategy on some deposit actions

params.maxShares: If totalSupply() exceeds this value, deposits will not be possible

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

tokenId().details: VaultManager token ID. This tokenId earn feeVaultManager provided by Platform.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `value`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `value`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `value`.

tvl().details: USD price of assets managed by strategy with 18 decimals      ONLY FOR OFF-CHAIN USE.      Not trusted TVL can be manipulated.

returns.trusted_: True means TVL calculated based only on oracle prices, false means AMM spot price was used.
returns.tvl_: Total USD value of final assets in vault

withdrawAssets(address[],uint256,uint256.details: Burning shares of vault and obtaining strategy assets.

params.assets_: Assets suitable for the strategy. Can be strategy assets, underlying asset or specific set of assets depending on strategy logic.
params.minAssetAmountsOut: Slippage tolerance. Minimal amounts of strategy assets that user must receive.

returns._0: Amount of assets for withdraw. It's related to assets_ one-by-one.

withdrawAssets(address[],uint256,uint256.details: Burning shares of vault and obtaining strategy assets.

params.assets_: Assets suitable for the strategy. Can be strategy assets, underlying asset or specific set of assets depending on strategy logic.
params.minAssetAmountsOut: Slippage tolerance. Minimal amounts of strategy assets that user must receive.

returns._0: Amount of assets for withdraw. It's related to assets_ one-by-one.

createdBlock().notice: Block number when contract was initialized

getApr().notice: All available data on the latest declared APR (annual percentage rate)

maxSupply().notice: Max supply of shares in the vault. Since the starting share price is $1, this ceiling can be considered as an approximate TVL limit.

strategy().notice: Immutable strategy proxy used by the vault

documentation.text: @dev Initial shares of the vault minted at the first deposit and sent to the dead address.
@dev Delay for calling strategy.doHardWork() on user deposits
@notice Data structure containing local variables for function depositAssets() to avoid stack too deep.
@notice Data structure containing local variables for function getApr() to avoid stack too deep.
